{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.04760v1", "title": "The spin measurement of the black hole SLX 1746-331 using Insight-HXMT
  observations", "summary": "We present an X-ray spectral analysis of a black hole X-ray binary SLX
1746-331 during the 2023 outburst using five \textit{Insight}-HXMT
observations. We jointly use the reflection model \texttt{relxillcp} and the
general relativistic thermal thin disk model \texttt{kerrbb} to fit the spectra
from 2 - 100 keV. By jointly fitting the five spectra, we constrained the black
hole mass to be $M=5.8\pm 0.3 M_{\odot}$ and dimensionless spin parameter to be
$a_{*}=0.88^{+0.01}_{-0.02}$ (90 percent statistical confidence). The
reflection model shows that SLX 1746-331 is a high-inclination system with the
inclination angle $i=63.7^{+1.3}_{-1.0}$ degrees, the accretion disk has a
density $\rm{log}N\sim 16 ~\rm cm^{-3}$. In addition, with the different
reflection model \texttt{relxilllp}, which assumes a lamp-post geometry corona,
we still give similar results.", "main_category": "astro-ph.HE", "categories": "astro-ph.HE,astro-ph.SR", "published": "2025-04-07T06:14:48Z"}
